title: Cat. 112  A Horse and Birds, 1899
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">A Horse and Birds, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile)  
1899  
First state of two  
Wood-block print in black ink on mottled gray-blue wove paper, laid down on buff wove paper; 142 × 221 mm (image); 168 × 245 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.255  
Guérin 4, Kornfeld 61

A Horse and Birds, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile)  
1899  
Second state of two  
Wood-block print in black ink on thin ivory laid Japanese paper; 141 × 221 mm (image); 153 × 230 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Frank B. Hubachek, 1946.32  
Guérin 74, Kornfeld 61 C

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">The Chicago sheet is a first-state impression undocumented in the catalogue raisonné; see Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 228–29, cat. 61.

The Chicago sheet is a first-state impression undocumented in the catalogue raisonné; see Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 228–29, cat. 61.

The catalogue raisonné of Gauguin’s prints erroneously listed the second state as first state. See Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 228, cat. 61. For the first-state impression, see cat. 112.1.

The catalogue raisonné of Gauguin’s prints erroneously listed the second state as first state. See Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 228, cat. 61. For the first-state impression, see cat. 112.1.

</section><section id="figures">Top, A Horse and Birds, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile), 1899 (cat. 112.1). Bottom, A Horse and Birds, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile), 1899 (cat. 112.2).

</section>
